service.name: Réclamer des avantages fiscaux
start.banner.1: L'Agence du revenu du Canada (ARC) vous a envoyé une lettre concernant le nouveau service
start.banner.3: Vous aurez besoin des renseignements figurant dans cette lettre pour produire votre déclaration de revenus de 2018 à l'aide de ce service.
start.p1: Vous pouvez utiliser ce service si l’Ontario était votre province de résidence le 31 décembre 2018. Vos revenus perçus pendant l’année d’imposition 2018 doivent être inférieurs à 35 000 $. De plus, vos revenus :
start.li1: doivent provenir d’un emploi, d’un régime de pension, d’un régime enregistré d’épargne-retraite (REER) ou de prestations comme celles d’aide au revenu.
start.li2: peuvent comprendre jusqu’à 1 000 $ de revenus d’intérêts provenant de sources canadiennes, comme un compte de banque ou d’épargne.
start.li3: ne peuvent pas provenir de votre entreprise personnelle ou d’un travail indépendant.
start.li4.1: Votre code personnel de déclaration de revenus. Vous trouverez ce code dans la lettre de l'ARC au sujet de ce nouveau service
Please correct the errors on the page: Veuillez corriger les erreurs trouvées dans cette page

Please enter the correct mailing address: Veuillez inscrire l’adresse postale exacte ci-dessous. Vous devez être capable de recevoir une lettre envoyée à cette adresse.
Enter your charitable donations: Inscrivez le montant de vos dons de bienfaisance
Your taxes can’t be completed using this: Vous ne pouvez pas utiliser ce service pour déclarer vos revenus
Your tax return is too complex to be fil: Votre déclaration de revenus est trop complexe pour être produite à l’aide de ce service. Il n’y a rien d’incorrect à propos de vos impôts — vous trouverez ci-dessous plus d’instructions sur la façon de produire votre déclaration de revenus.
To finish filing your taxes for 2018, yo: Afin de produire votre déclaration de revenus pour l’année 2018, vous devrez suivre l’une des mesures suivantes :
Use the paper form enclosed in the Claim: Remplir le formulaire papier compris dans le paquet « Obtenir mes avantages fiscaux » que vous avez reçu par la poste
Contact CRA at: Communiquer avec l’ARC en composant le
you paid for your main residence (includ: vous avez payé pour votre résidence principale (cela inclut un foyer privé de soins de longue durée) en 2018.
Review your estimated benefits: Passez en revue les avantages fiscaux estimés
Detailed breakdown of income earned in 2: Répartition détaillée du revenu gagné en 2018
Detailed breakdown of taxes paid in 2018: Répartition détaillée des impôts payés en 2018
Enter your political contributions: Inscrivez le montant de vos contributions politiques
Home energy costs on a reserve: Coûts d’énergie domiciliaire dans une réserve
Please enter the home energy costs paid: Veuillez inscrire les coûts d’énergie domiciliaire payés pour votre résidence principale située dans une réserve en Ontario en 2018.
the CRA's guide to eligible medical expe: guide des frais médicaux admissibles de l’ARC
Climate action incentive: Incitatif à agir pour le climat

Vous rendre à une clinique d’impôts gratuits.
You can have a volunteer help you submit: Vous pourrez obtenir l’aide d’une personne bénévole pour produire votre déclaration.

File your taxes another way: Produisez votre déclaration de revenus autrement
You can file your taxes even if you can’: Vous pouvez produire votre déclaration de revenus même si aucune question de sécurité ne vous convient. Voici d’autres moyens gratuits et sécuritaires de le faire :
By mail, using the form sent with the CR: Par la poste, en envoyant le formulaire fourni dans la lettre

pour trouver un comptoir dans votre région.
Using CRA software called: En utilisant le logiciel de l'ARC,
For more information, contact CRA by:: Pour de plus amples renseignements, communiquez avec l’ARC par :
You may get government benefits, credits: En produisant votre déclaration de revenus, vous pourriez obtenir des prestations, des crédits et un remboursement.
Enter date you became a resident of Cana: Entrez la date où vous avez obtenu un statut de résident au Canada
For income tax, you become a resident by: Dans le cadre de l’impôt sur le revenu, vous êtes un résident si vous avez établi des liens importants avec le Canada comme lieu de résidence. C’est généralement le cas le jour où vous arrivez au Canada.
If you ever lost permanent resident stat: Si vous avez perdu votre statut de résident permanent, inscrivez la date de votre retour au Canada.
Date you became a resident of Canada: La date où vous avez obtenu un statut de résident au Canada

Your taxes may be lower if your provinci: Your taxes may be lower if your provincial health plan, work or private insurance didn’t cover all your medical costs or expenses.
Treatment by a medical doctor, nurse or: Treatment by a medical doctor, nurse or dentist
Prescription glasses, hearing aids, whee: Prescription glasses, hearing aids, wheelchairs, crutches and similar items
Some travel expenses for medical treatme: Some travel expenses for medical treatment
You may be able to enter medical costs f: You may be able to enter medical costs for yourself and your children. You may also be able to enter costs for your partner by marriage or common-law, and their children.
To include a child’s medical costs, the: To include a child’s medical costs, the child must have been under 18 on December 31, 2018, and:
Depended on you for support for example,: Depended on you for support for example, with food, shelter, clothing
You or your partner must have had sole c: You or your partner must have had sole custody of the child
You may still be able to claim a child’s: You may still be able to claim a child’s medical expenses, even if you or your partner didn’t have sole custody. Contact CRA at,

Your marriage or common law partner: Your marriage or common law partner

Home energy costs are paid to heat or co: Home energy costs are paid to heat or cool your home, or use appliances like a stove or fridge.
In 2018, did you live on a reserve and p: In 2018, did you live on a reserve and pay home energy costs?

What were your total home energy costs o: What were your total home energy costs on reserve in 2018?
Please note you may be asked to provide: Please note you may be asked to provide receipts to verify this information later.
You may live in a long-term care home or: You may live in a long-term care home or facility if costs such as nursing or personal support are combined with your rent. The home must be public or non-profit. This means that a charity, city, First Nations, or similar organization manages the home.
Did you live in a public or non-profit l: Did you live in a public or non-profit long-term care home in 2018?
The government might ask for your long-t: The government might ask for your long-term care receipts.
How much were your total long-term care: How much were your total long-term care costs in 2018?
Enter your long-term care home costs: Enter your long-term care home costs
You live in a small and rural community: You live in a small and rural community if you don’t live in:
Ottawa, Kingston, Belleville, Peterborou: Ottawa, Kingston, Belleville, Peterborough, Oshawa, Toronto, Hamilton, St. Catharines-Niagara, Kitchener-Cambridge-Waterloo, Brantford, Guelph, London, Windsor, Barrie, Sudbury, or Thunder Bay.
Did you live in a small and rural commun: Did you live in a small and rural community in 2018?
The Climate Action Incentive (CAI) lower: The Climate Action Incentive (CAI) lowers the amount of tax you pay. And you may get money back from the CAI.
Your CAI is greater if you live in a sma: Your CAI is greater if you live in a small and rural community.
You can expect the following benefits an: You can expect the following benefits and refund from your 2018 taxes.
Please check this information. If anythi: Please check this information. If anything looks wrong, contact CRA before filing by:
Goods and services tax/harmonized sales: Goods and services tax/harmonized sales tax (GST/HST) credit
Please check that CRA has your correct a: Please check that CRA has your correct amounts for 2018. You may add credits and deductions later, but you won't be able to change the amounts for your income and taxes paid.
You can still use this online service wi: You can still use this online service with the name CRA has on your file.
ask CRA to change the name on your file.
You agree that CRA can use this informat: You agree that CRA can use this information to file your 2018 taxes.
You can find your SIN on your tax return: You can find your SIN on your tax return or other mail from Service Canada. Service Canada also gave you a card or confirmation letter with your SIN.
Your taxes may be lower if you gave mone: Your taxes may be lower if you gave money to a charity or similar organization. You will need an official tax receipt. The charity or organization must be registered with the government to give the receipt. You can enter any donations from the last five years that you didn't already include in your taxes.
Do you have tax receipts for charitable: Do you have tax receipts for charitable donations made in the last five years?
Your code has 9-characters and you can f: Your code has 9-characters and you can find it on the CRA
letter. The letter has your name and ad: letter. The letter has your name and address at the top.
You can’t use this online service becaus: You can’t use this online service because Ontario was not your home province on December 31, 2019. But you can still file your taxes. Other free and secure ways to file are:
You can't use this online service becaus: You can't use this online service because your income doesn't match what CRA has on file. But you can still file your taxes. Other free and secure ways to file are:
